See Comparative notes for [Verse 3.269].

B├╝hler

271 One year with cow-milk and milk-rice; from the flesh of a long-eared white he-goat their satisfaction endures twelve years.

272 рдХрд╛рд▓рд╢рд╛рдХрдореН рдорд╣рд╛рд╢рд▓реНрдХрд╛рдГ ...{Loading}...

рдХрд╛рд▓рд╢рд╛рдХрдВ рдорд╣рд╛рд╢рд▓реНрдХрд╛рдГ
рдЦрдЩреНрдЧ-рд▓реЛрд╣рд╛рдорд┐рд╖рдВ рдордзреБ ред
рдЖрдирдиреНрддреНрдпрд╛рдпреИрд╡ рдХрд▓реНрдкреНрдпрдиреНрддреЗ
рдореБрдиреНрдпреН-рдЕрдиреНрдирд╛рдирд┐ рдЪ рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╢рдГ рее рей.реиренреи рее [реиремреи рдореЗрдзрд╛рддрд┐рдерд┐рдкрд╛рдареЗ]

рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рд╖реН рдЯреАрдХрд╛рдГ ...{Loading}...
рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рдореВрд▓рд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ

The тАЬK─Бla┼Ы─Бka,тАЭ the porcupine, the meat of the rhinoceros and the red goat, and honey serve for endless time; as also all kinds ok her mitтАЩs food.тАФ(272)

рдореЗрдзрд╛рддрд┐рдерд┐рдГ

рдХрд╛рд▓рд╢рд╛рдХрдВ рд╡рд┐рд╢рд┐рд╖реНрдЯрд╢рд╛рдХрдВ рдкреНрд░рд╕рд┐рджреНрдзрдореН ред рдХреГрд╖реНрдгреЗ рд╡рд╛рд╕реНрддреБрдХрднреЗрджреЗ рд╡рд╛ ред251 рдорд╣рд╛рд╢рд▓реНрдХрд╛рдГ рд╢рд▓реНрдпрдХрд╛ рдЙрдЪреНрдпрдиреНрддреЗ ред рдЕрдиреНрдпреЗ рддреБ рдорддреНрд╕реНрдпрд╛рдиреН рд╕рд╢рд▓реНрдХрд╛рдиреН рдЖрд╣реБрдГ ред рдЦрдбреНрдЧреЛ рдЧрдгреНрдбрдХрдГ ред рд▓реЛрд╣рдГ рдХреГрд╖реНрдгрд╢реН рдЫрд╛рдЧрдГ рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд░рдХреНрддрд╢реН рдЪ ред рддрдерд╛ рдкреБрд░рд╛рдгрдореН-

  • рдХреГрд╖реНрдгрд╢реН рдЫрд╛рдЧрд╕реН рддрдерд╛ рд░рдХреНрдд рдЖрдирдиреНрддреНрдпрд╛рдпреИрд╡ рдХрд▓реНрдкрддреЗ ред

рд▓реЛрд╣рд╢рдмреНрджреЛ рд╡рд░реНрдгрд▓рдХреНрд╖рдгрдпрд╛ рддрджреНрд╡рд░реНрдгрдпреБрдХреНрддреЗ рдЫрд╛рдЧреЗ рд╡рд░реНрддрддреЗ ред рдЕрдпрдГрдХреГрд╖реНрдгрдВ рддрд╛рдореНрд░рдВ рд▓реЛрд╣рд┐рддрдВ рдЙрднрдпрддреНрд░рд╛рдкрд┐ рд▓реЛрд╣рд╢рдмреНрджрдГ рдкреНрд░рдпреБрдЬреНрдпрддреЗ ред рдпрджреНрдпреН рдЕрдкрд┐ рдЪреИрд╖ рд╡рд░реНрдгреЛ рдореЗрд╖рд╛рджрд┐рд╖реНрд╡реН рдЕрдкрд┐ рд╕рдВрднрд╡рддрд┐ рддрдерд╛рдкрд┐ рд╕реНрдореГрддреНрдпрдиреНрддрд░рдкреНрд░рд╕рд┐рджреНрдзреНрдпрд╛ рдЫрд╛рдЧ рдПрд╡ рдЧреГрд╣реНрдпрдд рдЗрддрд┐ рд╡реНрдпрд╛рдЪрдХреНрд╖рддреЗ ред рдЕрдиреНрдпреЗ рддреБ рд╢рдХреБрдирд┐рд░реН рд▓реЛрд╣рд┐рддрдкреГрд╖реНрдардГ рдирд╛рдореИрдХрджреЗрд╢реЗрди, рджреЗрд╡рджрддреНрддреЛ рджрддреНрдд рдЗрддрд┐рд╡рддреН, рдкреНрд░рддрд┐рдкрд╛рджреНрдпрдд рдЗрддреНрдпреН рдЖрд╣реБрдГ ред рд╕рдорд╛рдЪрд╛рд░рд╢реН рдЪреЛрднрдпрддреНрд░рд╛рдкреНрдпреН рдЕрдиреНрд╡реЗрд╖реНрдпрдГ ред рдордзреБ рдорд╛рдХреНрд╖рд┐рдХрдореН ред рд╕рд░реНрд╡рддреНрд░рд╛рддреНрд░ рдкреНрд░реАрддреНрдпрддрд┐рд╢рдпреЛрддреНрдкрддреНрддрд┐рд░реН рд╡рд┐рд╡рдХреНрд╖рд┐рддрд╛, рди рддреБ рдпрдерд╛рд╢реНрд░реБрдд рдПрд╡ рдХрд╛рд▓рдГ ред рддрдерд╛ рд╣рд┐ рджреНрд╡рд╛рджрд╢рд╡рд░реНрд╖рд╛рдгреНрдпреН рдЕрдХрд░рдгрдВ рд╕реНрдпрд╛рддреН ред рддрддреНрд░ рд╡рд┐рд░реБрдзреНрдпреЗрдд “рдкрд┐рддреНрд░реНрдпрдореН рдЖ рдирд┐рдзрдирд╛рддреН рдХрд╛рд░реНрдпрдореН” (рдореНрдзреН рей.реиремреп) рдЗрддрд┐ рее рей.реиремреи рее

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рднрд╛рд╖реНрдпрд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ

тАШK─Бla┼Ы─БkaтАЩтАФis a well-known variety of vegetable; applying to the darker variety of the тАШV─Бst┼лka.тАЩ

тАШMah─Б┼ЫalkaтАЩ stands for the porcupine. Others have explained it as standing for a special kind of fish.

тАШKhaс╕НgaтАЩтАФRhinoceros.

тАШLohaтАЩтАФthe black goat, or one whi├зh is red all over. Says the Pur─Бс╣ЗaтАФтАШthe red goat, and the black one, serve for endless time.тАЩ Though the term тАШlohaтАЩ denotes the colour, it indirectly indicates the goat having that colour. The term тАШlohaтАЩ is used in the sense of тАШblackтАЩ as well as тАШredтАЩтАФbeing applied to iron, which is black, as also to copper which is red. Though this variety of colour is found in sheep and other animals also, yet, on the strength of other Smс╣Ыtis, it has been explained here as standing for the goat only.

Others, however, have explained the term тАШlohaтАЩ as standing for the bird, called тАШlohapс╣Ыс╣гс╣нha,тАЩ the Heron; which is mentioned by means of a part of the name only. Just as Devadatta is often spoken of as simply тАШDatta.тАЩ

It is necessary to find the support of usage in the case of both these explanations.

тАШHoneyтАЩтАФthat collected by bees.

In the case of all the things mentioned in the present contest, all that is meant is the great satisfaction produced by the offerings; and stress is not meant to be laid upon the exact period of time mentioned in each case. If this were really meant, then one might be justified in omitting the performance of ┼Ъr─Бddhas for twelve years; and this would be contrary to what has been declared, to the effect that тАШRites in honour of the Pitс╣Ыs should be performed till death.тАЩ (Verse 279).тАФ(272)

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рдЯрд┐рдкреНрдкрдиреНрдпрдГ

тАШK─Бla┼Ы─БkaтАЩтАФBuhler has misread Medh─Бtithi; there is no such expression in Medh─Бtithi as тАШKс╣Ыс╣гс╣Зav─БsudevaтАЩ; the word used is Kс╣Ыс╣гс╣Зe v─Бstukabhede, which means тАШthe darker variety of the v─Бstuka herbтАЩ. According to Nandana, it stands for the тАШBlack neemтАЩ.тАФPar─Б┼Ыaram─Бdhava (─Аc─Бra, p. 706) quoting the verse, explains it as тАШwell known in the northern countryтАЩ.

тАШMah─Б┼ЫalkaтАЩтАФMedh─Бtithi explains this as тАШ┼Ыalyak─БтАЩ, тАШthe porcupineтАЩ, or (according to тАШothersтАЩ, a kind of fish). [Medh─Бtithi says nothing as to тАШothersтАЩ reading тАШsa┼Ыalkh─БnтАЩ].тАФPar─Б┼Ыaram─Бdhava explains it as тАШa particular kind of fishтАЩ;тАФтАШlohaтАЩ as тАШthe red-coloured goatтАЩтАФand тАШmunyannaтАЩ as тАШN─лv─Бra and the likeтАЩ.

This verse is quoted in Hem─Бdri (┼Ъr─Бddha, pp. 541 and 586);тАФin ┼Ъr─Бddhakriy─Бkaumud─л (p. 14), which says that according to the тАШancientsтАЩ, тАШmah─Б┼ЫalkaтАЩ stands for the Rohita fish;тАФand in Gad─Бdharapaddhati (K─Бla, p. 536).

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рддреБрд▓реНрдп-рд╡рд╛рдХреНрдпрд╛рдирд┐

─Аpastamba-Dharmas┼лtra (2.17.1-3).тАФтАШFor endless time, with the meat of the rhinoceros; so also with the meat of the ┼Ъ─Бtabali fish, and that of the old goat.тАЩ

Viс╣гс╣Зu (80.23-24).тАФтАШHere is the song sung by the Pitс╣ЫsтАФK─Бla┼Ы─Бka, porcupine, the meat of the old goat, and the rhinoceros without horns,тАФthese we eat constantly.тАЩ

Y─Бj├▒avalkya (1.260).тАФтАШThe meat of the rhinoceros, the porcupine, honey, hermitтАЩs food, meat of the red goat, Mah─Б┼Ы─Бka, and the meat of the old goat.тАЩ

B├╝hler

272 The (vegetable called) Kalasaka, (the fish called) Mahasalka, the flesh of a rhinoceros and that of a red goat, and all kinds of food eaten by hermits in the forest serve for an endless time.

273 рдпрддреН рдХрд┐рдореН ...{Loading}...

рдпрддреН рдХрд┐рдВ рдЪрд┐рдиреН рдордзреБрдирд╛ рдорд┐рд╢реНрд░рдВ
рдкреНрд░рджрджреНрдпрд╛рддреН рддреБ рддреНрд░рдпреЛрджрд╢реАрдореН ред
рддрджреН рдЕрдкреНрдпреН рдЕрдХреНрд╖рдпрдореН рдПрд╡ рд╕реНрдпрд╛рджреН
рд╡рд░реНрд╖рд╛рд╕реБ рдЪ рдордШрд╛рд╕реБ рдЪ рее рей.реиренрей рее [реиремрей рдореЗрдзрд╛рддрд┐рдерд┐рдкрд╛рдареЗ]

рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рд╖реН рдЯреАрдХрд╛рдГ ...{Loading}...
рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рдореВрд▓рд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ

Whatever thing, mixed with honey, one might offer on the thirteenth day of the month, during the rains, under the asterism of Magh─Б,тАФthat also would be imperishable.тАФ(273)

рдореЗрдзрд╛рддрд┐рдерд┐рдГ

рдпрддреН рдХрд┐рдВрдЪрд┐рджреН рдЕрдиреНрдирдВ рдордзреБрдирд╛ рд╕рдВрдпреБрдХреНрддрдореН ред рддреНрд░рдпреЛрджрд╢реНрдпрд╛рдВ рд╡рд░реНрд╖рд╛рд╕реБ рдЪ рдордШрд╛рд╕реБ рдЪрд╛рдзрд┐рдХрдореН рдЗрддрд┐ ред рддрджрд╛ рдЪ рддрджреН рдЕрдХреНрд╖рдпрдореН рдПрд╡ ред рдЛрддреБрдирдХреНрд╖рддреНрд░рддрд┐рдереАрдирд╛рдВ рдЪ рд╕рдореБрдЪреНрдЪрдпрдГ ред рдЖрдкрд╕реНрддрдореНрдмрд╡рдЪрдирд╛рддреН рддреБ рд╡рд░реНрд╖рд╛рд╕реБ рддреНрд░рдпреЛрджрд╢реНрдпрд╖реНрдЯрдореАрджрд╢рдореАрд╖реНрд╡реН252 рдЕрдкрд┐ ред рдордШрд╛рд╕реБ рдЪрд╛рдиреНрддрд░реЗрдгрд╛рд╡рд┐рд╡рдХреНрд╖рд╛ ред рдПрд╡рдВ рд╣ рд╕реНрдорд╛рд╣ “рдордШрд╛рд╕реБ рдЪрд╛рдзрд┐рдХрдореН” рдЗрддрд┐ (рдЖрдкреНрдзреН реи.резреп.реиреж) рее рей.реиремрей рее

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рднрд╛рд╖реНрдпрд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ

тАШWhateverтАЩтАФfoodтАФтАШmixed with honey;тАЩтАФтАШon the thirteenth day, during the rains, and under the asterism of Magh─Б,тАЩтАФтАШthat is imperishable,тАЩ The season, the asterism and the date are to be taken together as the desired qualification.

According to the declaration of ─Аpastamba, the same holds good regarding offerings made during the rains, on the thirteenth, eighth and tenth days of the month also. As regards the asterism of Magh─Б, however, there is no option; as he saysтАФтАШthere is abundance under the asterism of Magh─Б,тАЩ (─Аpastamba, 2.8.19-20).тАФ(273)

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рдЯрд┐рдкреНрдкрдиреНрдпрдГ

тАЬThe day meant is Bh─Бdrapada, Badi, 13тАЭтАФBuhler.

This verse is quoted in Smс╣Ыtitattva (p. 117) without comment;тАФin Apar─Бrka (p. 555), which adds that the Accusative ending in тАШtrayoda┼Ы─лmтАЩ has the force of the Locative;тАФin Hem─Бdri (┼Ъr─Бddha, p. 201);тАФin ┼Ъr─Бddhakriy─Бkaumud─л (p. 272), which explains the meaning as тАШwhatever mixed with Honey is offered on the thirteenth of the month, under the asterism of Magh─Б becomes inexhaustibleтАЩ;тАФin Puruс╣г─Бrthacint─Бmaс╣Зi (p. 385);тАФin Varс╣гakriy─Бkaumud─л (p. 356);тАФand in Hem─Бdri (K─Бla, p. 470 and ┼Ъr─Бddha, p. 87).

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рддреБрд▓реНрдп-рд╡рд╛рдХреНрдпрд╛рдирд┐

Mah─Бbh─Бrata (13.88.15).тАФтАШWater, roots, fruits, meat, and grainsтАФwhatsoever is mixed with honey and offered during Pitс╣Ыpakс╣гa, is conducive to imperishability.тАЩ

Y─Бj├▒avalkya (1.260).тАФтАШDuring the rains, on the thirteenth day of the month, and during the asterism of Magh─Б.тАЩ

Pitс╣Ыg─Бth─Б (Apar─Бrka, p. 555).тАФтАШMay some one be born in our family who may offer rice cooked in milk mixed with honey and butter, during the rains, on the thirteenth day of the month and during the asterism of Magh─Б.тАЩ

Va┼Ыiс╣гс╣нha (Do.).тАФтАШThe ancestors rejoice at the birth of a son in the hope that he would offer ┼Ъr─Бddha to them with honey, meat, vegetables, milk and rice cooked in milk.тАЩ

Paiс╣нh─лnasi (Apar─Бrka, p. 555).тАФтАШA son or a grandson may offer to us ┼Ъr─Бddha with a red goat during the rains, during the asterism of Magh─Б, on the thirteenth day of the month.тАЩ

B├╝hler

273 Whatever (food), mixed with honey, one gives on the thirteenth lunar day in the rainy season under the asterism of Maghah, that also procures endless (satisfaction).

рдХрд╛рд▓рдГ

274 рдЕрдкрд┐ рдирдГ ...{Loading}...

рдЕрдкрд┐ рдирдГ рд╕ рдХреБрд▓реЗ рднреВрдпрд╛рджреН
рдпреЛ рдиреЛ рджрджреНрдпрд╛рддреН рддреНрд░рдпреЛрджрд╢реАрдореН ред
рдкрд╛рдпрд╕рдВ рдордзреБ-рд╕рд░реНрдкрд┐рд░реНрднреНрдпрд╛рдВ
рдкреНрд░рд╛рдХреН рдЫрд╛рдпреЗ рдХреБрдЮреНрдЬрд░рд╕реНрдп рдЪ +++(тЖТ рдЕрдкрд░рд╛рд╣реНрдгреЗ)+++ рее рей.реиренрек рее [реиремрек рдореЗрдзрд╛рддрд┐рдерд┐рдкрд╛рдареЗ]

рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рд╖реН рдЯреАрдХрд╛рдГ ...{Loading}...
рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рдореВрд▓рд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ

тАШMay there be one in our family, who may offer milk-rice mixed with honey and butter on the thirteenth, and when the shadow of the elephant falls towards the east.тАЩтАФ(274)

yadenduс╕е pitс╣Ыdaivatye haс╣Гsa┼Ыcaiva kare sthitaс╕е | y─Бmy─Бс╣Г tithirbhavets─Бhi gajacch─Бy─Б prak─лrtit─Б ||

рдореЗрдзрд╛рддрд┐рдерд┐рдГ

рдкреНрд░рдХреГрддрд╛рдВ рддреНрд░рдпреЛрджрд╢реАрдВ рд╡рд░реНрд╖рд╛рджрд┐рдЧреБрдгрдпреБрдХреНрддрд╛рдореН рдЕрдзрд┐рдХреГрддреНрдпреЗрджрдореН рдЙрдЪреНрдпрддреЗ ред рдПрд╡рдВ рдкрд┐рддрд░ рдЖрд╢рд╛рд╕реНрддреЗ ред рдЕрд╕реНрдордХрдВ рдХреБрд▓реЗ рднреВрдпрд╛рддреН рд╕ рддрд╛рджреГрд╢реЛ рдЬрд╛рдпрддрд╛рдореН рдЙрддреНрдХреГрд╖реНрдЯрдЧреБрдгрдГ рдпрдГ рдкреНрд░рд╛рдЧреБрдХреНрддрд╛рдпрд╛рдВ рддреНрд░рдпреЛрджрд╢реНрдпрд╛рдореН рдЕрд╕реНрдорднреНрдпрдВ рджрджреНрдпрд╛рддреН рдкрд╛рдпрд╕рдВ рдордзреБрд╕рд░реНрдкрд┐рдГрд╕рдВрдпреБрдХреНрддрдореН ред рддрдерд╛ рдХреБрдЮреНрдЬрд░рд╕реНрдп рд╣рд╕реНрддрд┐рдирдГ рдкреНрд░рд╛рдХреНрдЫрд╛рдпреЗ рдкреНрд░рд╛рдЪреНрдпрд╛рдВ рджрд┐рд╢рд┐ рдЧрддрд╛рдпрд╛рдВ рдЫрд╛рдпрд╛рдпрд╛рдореН, рдЕрдкрд░рд╛рд╣реНрдгреЗрддрд░реЗ рдХрд╛рд▓ рдЗрддреНрдпреН рдЕрд░реНрдердГ ред рд╢реЗрд╖реЗ рд╜рд╣рдирд┐ рд╣рд╕реНрддрд┐рдиреЛ рджреАрд░реНрдШрд╛ рдкреНрд░рд╛рдЪреА рдЫрд╛рдпрд╛ рднрд╡рддрд┐ ред “рдкреНрд░рд╛рдХреНрдЫрд╛рдпрд╛рдореН” рдЗрддрд┐ рд╡рд╛ рдкрд╛рдардГ ред рдЫрд╛рдпрд╛рдпрд╛рдВ рд╣рд┐ рдмреНрд░рд╛рдГрдордгрд╛ рднреЛрдЬреНрдпрдиреНрддреЗ ред рдЕрдЧреНрд░рд┐рдордВ рдХрд░реНрдо рддреБ рдпрджреНрдпреН рдЕрд▓реНрдкрддреНрд╡рд╛рдЪреН рдЫрд╛рдпрд╛рдпрд╛рдВ рди рд╕рдВрднрд╡рддрд┐, рддрджреНрджреЗрд╢рд╛рдиреНрддрд░реЗ рддрддреНрд╕рдореАрдкреЗ рдХрд░реНрддрд╡реНрдпрдореН ред рдЕрдЩреНрдЧрддреНрд╡рд╛рддреН рд╕рддрд┐ рд╕рдВрднрд╡реЗ рддрддреНрд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рдЩреНрдЧреЛрдкреЗрддрдВ рдкреНрд░рдзрд╛рдирдВ рд╣рд╕реНрддрд┐рдЫрд╛рдпрд╛рдпрд╛рдореН рдПрд╡ ред

  • рдпрддреН рддреБ рд╡реНрдпрд╛рдЪрдХреНрд╖рддреЗ- рдЧреНрд░рд╣реЛрдкрд░рд╛рдЧреЛ рд╣рд╕реНрддрд┐рдЫрд╛рдпреЛрдЪреНрдпрддреЗ ред “рд╣рд╕реНрддреА рд╡реИ рднреВрддреНрд╡рд╛ рд╕реНрд╡рд░реНрднрд╛рдиреБрд░реН рдЖрд╕реБрд░рд┐рд░реН рдЖрджрд┐рддреНрдпрдВ рддрдорд╕рд╛рд╡рд┐рдзреНрдпрддреН” (рдЪреНреЬреНред рдкреНрдмреН резрек.резрез.резрек) рдЗрддрд┐

  • рддрджреН рдЕрдпреБрдХреНрддрдореН ред рддрддреНрд░ рд╣рд┐ рдЧреМрдгреЛ рд╣рд╕реНрддрд┐рд╢рдмреНрджрдкреНрд░рдпреЛрдЧрдГ ред рд╕реНрдореГрддреНрдпрдиреНрддрд░реЗ рдЪ рдкреГрдердЧреН рдПрд╡ рд╣рд╕реНрддрд┐рдЫрд╛рдпрд╛ рдЧреНрд░рд╣реЛрдкрд░рд╛рдЧрд╛рджреН рдЖрдореНрдирд╛рддрд╛ “рд╣рд╕реНрддрд┐рдЫрд╛рдпрд╛ рдЧреНрд░рд╣рдгрдВ рдЪрдиреНрджреНрд░рд╕реВрд░реНрдпрдпреЛрдГ” (рдпреНрдзреН рез.реирезрео) рдЗрддрд┐ рее рей.реиремрек рее

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рднрд╛рд╖реНрдпрд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ

What is said here is with reference to the thirteenth day of the month spoken of above, as accompanied by the rainy season and the asterism of Magh─Б.

What is described in the text is the wish expressed by the Pitс╣Ыs.

тАШMay there beтАЩтАФbornтАФтАШin our famityтАЩтАФone such person, endowed with excellent qualities, who may offer to us, on the said thirteenth day, тАШmilk-rice mixed with honey and butter;тАЩтАФalso тАШwhen the shadow of the elephant falls towards the east;тАЩ i.e., during the afternoon; towards the close of day, the shadow cast by the elephant is long and falls towards the East.

Another reading for тАШpr─Бkch─Бy─БтАЩ is тАШpr─Бkch─Бy─Бm;тАЩ it is in a shady place that Br─Бhmaс╣Зas are fed; as for the rest of the rite, if the shade is not enough to permit of its being done there, then it should be done in a place close to the shadow. Since the details form part of the rite, the whole of it should, as far as possible, be performed in the shadow of the elephant.

Some people have explained the term тАШshadow of the elephantтАЩ to mean тАШeclipse,тАЩ adding that R─Бhu takes the shape of the elephant and pierces the sun with darkness.

But this is not right; as in that case, the term тАШelephantтАЩ will have to ba regarded as figurative. Further, in another Smс╣Ыti the тАШelephantтАЩs shadowтАЩ has been described as something entirely different from eclipse:тАФтАШthe elephantтАЩs shadow, the eclipse of the Sun, and the eclipse of the MoonтАЩ [where the three are mentioned as distinct from one another].тАФ(274)

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рдЯрд┐рдкреНрдкрдиреНрдпрдГ

тАШPr─Бkch─Бye ku├▒jarasyaтАЩтАФтАШIn the afternoon, when the shadow cast by the elephant falls towards the EastтАЩ (Medh─Бtithi, Kull┼лka, N─Бr─Бyaс╣Зa and R─Бghav─Бnanda);тАФтАШdaring an eclipseтАЩ (тАШothersтАЩ in Medh─Бtithi, who rejects it).тАФMit─Бkс╣гar─Б (on 1.218) quotes a definition by which the name applies to a particular dayтАФ

yadenduс╕е pitс╣Ыdaivatye haс╣Гsa┼Ыcaiva kare sthitaс╕е |
y─Бmy─Бс╣Г tithirbhavets─Бhi gajacch─Бy─Б prak─лrtit─Б ||

This verse is quoted in Nirс╣Зayasindhu (p. 109), which quotes from V─Бyupur─Бс╣Зa a definition of тАШGajacch─Бy─БтАЩ as the 13th day of the month during which the sun lies in the asterism of Hast─Б, and the moon in that of Magh─Б;тАФin Hem─Бdri (┼Ъr─Бddha, p. 245);тАФin ┼Ъr─Бddhakriy─Бkaumud─л (p. 271), which explains тАШdady─БtтАЩ as тАШdad─БtiтАЩ and тАШpr─Бkch─Бye etc.тАЩ as тАШwhen the shadow of the elephant is cast towards the East,тАЩ and notes that this is mere Arthav─Бda;тАФand in Vaс╣Ыс╣гakriy─Бkaumud─л (p. 355).

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рддреБрд▓реНрдп-рд╡рд╛рдХреНрдпрд╛рдирд┐

Mah─Бbh─Бrata (13.88.12). [after reproducing the first line of Manu].тАФтАШDuring the asterism of Magh─Б, during the Southern Sojourn of the sun, offering milk-preparations mixed with honey and butter.тАЩ

Va┼Ыiс╣гс╣нha (11.37).тАФтАШThis person shall offer ┼Ъr─Бddha to us, during с╣нhe rains and during the asterism of Magh─Б, with honey and meats, vegetables, milk and milk-preparations.тАЩ

Viс╣гс╣Зu (78.52-53).тАФтАШMay some one, the best among men, be born in our family who, during the rains, on the thirteenth day of the brighter fortnight, perform ┼Ъr─Бddha with honey offered profusely; as also during the whole month of K─Бrtika, and when the ElephantтАЩs shadow falls towards the East.тАЩ

B├╝hler

274 ‘May such a man (the manes say) be born in our family who will give us milk-rice, with honey and clarified butter, on the thirteenth lunar day (of the month of Bhadrapada) and (in the afternoon) when the shadow of an elephant falls towards the east.’

275 рдпрджреН рдпрджреН ...{Loading}...

рдпрджреН рдпрджреН рджрджрд╛рддрд┐ рд╡рд┐рдзрд┐рд╡рддреН
рд╕рдореНрдпрдХреН рд╢реНрд░рджреНрдзрд╛рд╕рдордиреНрд╡рд┐рддрдГ ред
рддрддреН рддрддреН рдкрд┐рддреДрдгрд╛рдВ рднрд╡рддрд┐
рдкрд░рддреНрд░рд╛рд╜рдирдиреНрддрдореН рдЕрдХреНрд╖рдпрдореН рее рей.реиренрел рее [реиремрел рдореЗрдзрд╛рддрд┐рдерд┐рдкрд╛рдареЗ]

рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рд╖реН рдЯреАрдХрд╛рдГ ...{Loading}...
рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рдореВрд▓рд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ

Whatever one endowed with faith, offers, according to rule and in the right manner,тАФthat becomes endless and inexhaustible for the Pitс╣Ыs in the other world.тАФ(275)

рдореЗрдзрд╛рддрд┐рдерд┐рдГ

рдпрджреН рдпрджреН рдЗрддрд┐ рд╡реАрдкреНрд╕рд╛рдпрд╛рдореН рдЕрдкреНрд░рддрд┐рд╖рд┐рджреНрдзрдВ рд╕рд░реНрд╡рдореН рдЕрдиреНрдирдореН рдЕрдиреБрдЬрд╛рдирд╛рддрд┐ ред рд╡рд┐рдзрд┐рд╡рддреН рд╕рдореНрдпрдХреН рд╢рдмреНрджрд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ ред рд╢реНрд░рджреНрдзрд╛рд╕рдордиреНрд╡рд┐рдд рдЗрддреНрдпреН рдПрддрджреН рдЕрддреНрд░ рд╡рд┐рдзреАрдпрддреЗ ред рд╢реНрд░рджреНрджрдпрд╛ рджрд╛рддрд╡реНрдпрдореН ред рддрдерд╛ рджрддреНрддрдореН рдЕрдирдиреНрддрдореН рдЕрдХреНрд╖рдпрдВ рднрд╡рддрд┐ рдкрд┐рддреДрдгрд╛рдВ рдкрд░рд▓реЛрдХреЗ ред рдЕрдирдиреНрддрдореН рдЗрддрд┐ рд╡рд╛ рдХрд╛рд▓рд╛рд╡рдзрд┐рдирд┐рд╖реЗрдзрдГ ред рдЕрдХреНрд╖рдпрдореН рдЗрддрд┐ рдорд╛рддреНрд░рдпрд╛ рд╡реНрдпрдпрд╛рднрд╛рд╡рдореН рдЖрд╣ ред рд╕рд░реНрд╡рдХрд╛рд▓рдВ рднрд╡рддрд┐ рдкреНрд░рднреВрддрдВ рдЪ рее рей.реиремрел рее

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рднрд╛рд╖реНрдпрд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ

тАШWhatever.тАЩтАФThis term sanctions the offering of everything, not actually prohibited.

тАШAccording to ruleтАЩ is a reiteration of what has been said by means of the term, тАШin the right manner.тАЩ

тАШEndowed with faithтАЩтАФ This is what is actually prescribed in the present verse:тАФтАШone should make the offering with due faith.тАЩ

What is given in this manner тАШbecomes endless and inexhaustible for the Pitс╣Ыs in the other world.тАЩ тАШEndlessтАЩ may be taken as denying all limitation of time;тАФтАШInexhaustibleтАЩ denies non-diminishing of quantity; the sense being тАШit lasts for all time and becomes large in quantity.тАЩтАФ(275)

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рдЯрд┐рдкреНрдкрдиреНрдпрдГ

This verse is quoted in Hem─Бdri (┼Ъr─Бddha, p. 1031):тАФand in Gad─Бdharapaddhati (K─Бla, p. 551).

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рддреБрд▓реНрдп-рд╡рд╛рдХреНрдпрд╛рдирд┐

Baudh─Бyana (2.62-65).тАФтАШThe gods desirous of purity do not accept the offerings of the faithless. The gods discussed the relative merits of the person who is pure but faithless and he who is not pure but full of faith, and came to the conclusion that both were equal; hut Praj─Бpati said to them: тАЬThey are not equal; there is great difference; as the ┼Ъr─Бddha offered by the faithless is damned; what is sanctified by faith is distinctly superior.тАЭ In this connection, they have the following sayingтАФWant of faith is a great sin; faith is the highest austerity; therefore, what is offered without faith, the gods never accept.тАЩ

Mah─Бbh─Бrata (13.188.72, 79).тАФтАШThose men who offer ┼Ъr─Бddhas with due faith save their forefathers from the most terrible hell; he who performs the ┼Ъr─Бddha with faith becomes freed from the debt owing to the Pitс╣Ыs.тАЩ

B├╝hler

275 Whatever (a man), full of faith, duly gives according to the prescribed rule, that becomes in the other world a perpetual and imperishable (gratification) for the manes.

276 рдХреГрд╖реНрдгрдкрдХреНрд╖реЗ рджрд╢рдореНрдпрд╛рджреМ ...{Loading}...

рдХреГрд╖реНрдгрдкрдХреНрд╖реЗ рджрд╢рдореНрдпрд╛рджреМ
рд╡рд░реНрдЬрдпрд┐рддреНрд╡рд╛ рдЪрддреБрд░реНрджрд╢реАрдореН ред
рд╢реНрд░рд╛рджреНрдзреЗ рдкреНрд░рд╢рд╕реНрддрд╛рд╕реН рддрд┐рдердпреЛ
рдпрдереИрддрд╛ рди рддрдереЗрддрд░рд╛рдГ рее рей.реиренрем рее [реиремрем рдореЗрдзрд╛рддрд┐рдерд┐рдкрд╛рдареЗ]

рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рд╖реН рдЯреАрдХрд╛рдГ ...{Loading}...
рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рдореВрд▓рд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ

тАШNo dates are so commended for the offering of ┼Ыr─Бddha as those of the dark fortnight, beginning with the tenth day, leaving out the fourteenth.тАФ(276)

рдореЗрдзрд╛рддрд┐рдерд┐рдГ

рджрд╢рдореНрдпрд╛рджреАрдирд╛рдВ рд╡рдЪрдирд╛рддреН рдлрд▓рд╛рддрд┐рд╢рдпреЛрддреНрдкрддреНрддрд┐рдГ ред рдЕрдиреНрдпрд╛рд╕реНрд╡реН рдЕрдкрд┐ рддреБ рд╕рддреНрдпрд╛рдВ рд╢реНрд░рджреНрдзрд╛рдпрд╛рдВ рдХрд░реНрддрд╡реНрдпрдореН ред рдЪрддреБрд░реНрджрд╢реНрдпрд╛рдВ рддреБ рдирд┐рд╖реЗрдз рдПрд╡ рее рей.реиремрем рее

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рднрд╛рд╖реНрдпрд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ

The mention of the days beginning with the tenth, indicates that the offering is attended by excellent results. So that on other days also the offering is to be made, if due faith is there. But on the fourteenth day there is absolute prohibition.тАФ(276)

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рдЯрд┐рдкреНрдкрдиреНрдпрдГ

This verse is quoted in Par─Б┼Ыaram─Бdhava (─Аc─Бra, p. 666) as laying down what one should do in the event of his being unable to perform the ┼Ъr─Бddha throughout the dark fortnight;тАФin Madanap─Бrij─Бta (p. 524), which remarks that this verse implies also the alternative of beginning the ┼Ъr─Бddha on the fifth and going on daily till the fifteenth;тАФin Smс╣Ыtitattva (on p. 173, again on p. 252) as forbidding the performance of ┼Ъr─Бddha on the fourteenth,тАФand again on p. 845 as forbidding the performance of the ┼Ъr─Бddha on the fourteenth day of the dark fortnight of all months;тАФin Apar─Бrka (p. 422), which adds that the alternative here laid down is that of beginning the performance of the ┼Ъr─Бddha on the tenth day of the fortnight;тАФin Gad─Бdharapaddhati (K─Бla, p. 467), which says that it refers to the Mah─Бlay─Б-┼Ыr─Бddha;тАФin Smс╣Ыtis─Бroddh─Бra (p, 187) in support of the view that only five, not ten, days of the kс╣Ыс╣гс╣Зapakс╣гa are specially commended, these being the 10th, 11th, 12th, 13th, and 15th days;тАФin ┼Ъr─Бddhakriy─Бkaumud─л (p. 6);тАФin Varс╣гakriy─Бkaumud─л (p, 350);тАФin Puruс╣г─Бrthacint─Бmaс╣Зi (p. 382);тАФin Hem─Бdri (K─Бla p. 461), which adds that the fourteenth day is not to be excluded entirely, it is to be avoided only for the ┼Ъr─Бddha to three тАШdeitiesтАЩ with the exception of that offered to those killed with weapons;тАФand in Hem─Бdri (┼Ъr─Бddha, p. 194).

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рддреБрд▓реНрдп-рд╡рд╛рдХреНрдпрд╛рдирд┐

Gautama (15.2-3).тАФтАШCommencing from the fifth day of the Aparapakс╣гa, ┼Ъr─Бddha should bo performed;тАФor on all days.тАЩ

─Аpastamba (2.16.6).тАФтАШSo also during the later days of the Aparapakс╣гa.тАЩ

K─Бty─Бyana and Gautama (quoted in Caturvargacint─Бmaс╣Зi-┼Ъr─Бddha, p. 293).тАФтАШOne should make the offering to the Pitс╣Ыs on the moonless day; or on the days commencing from the fifth of the Aparapakс╣гa; or according as he may have faith, on all days, whenever the right substance, place and Br─Бhmaс╣Зas may be available.тАЩ

─Аpastamba (quoted in Caturvargacint─Бmaс╣Зi-┼Ъr─Бddha, p. 194).тАФтАШIt should be offered every month; the afternoon of the Aparapakс╣гa is highly commendable, as also the latter days of the Aparapakс╣гa.тАЩ

Y─Бj├▒avalkya (1.264).тАФтАШCommencing from the first day, excepting the fourteenth day; on this latter day it is offered to those who may have been killed by weapons.тАЩ

M─Бrkaс╣Зс╕Нeya (Par─Б┼Ыaram─Бdhava, p. 663).тАФтАШWhen the sun is in the sign of Virgo, there are fifteen days, on which the performance of ┼Ъr─Бddha has been prescribed;тАФon the first day, for obtaining wealth; on the second, for obtaining progeny; on the third, for obtaining good things; on the fourth for destruction of enemies; on the fifth, for obtaining prosperity; on the sixth, the man obtains honour; on the seventh, the man becomes leader of his clan; on the eighth, excellent intelligence; on the ninth he obtains excellent wives; on the tenth, he fulfils all his desires; on the eleventh, he acquires all the Vedas; on the twelfth, he obtains gold; by offering it on the thirteenth day, he obtains children, memory, cattle, sound body, freedom, excellent prosperity, long-life, power and riches. Those who seek the welfare of those ancestors who were killed in youth by weapons should offer the ┼Ъr─Бddha on the fourteenth day. The man offering ┼Ъr─Бddha with food on the moonless day obtains all that he desires and goes to heaven.тАЩ

Vс╣Ыddha-Manu (Do.).тАФтАШWhen the sun enters the sign of Virgo, the dark fortnight is called the Mah─Бlaya, as also the Gajacch─Бy─Б.тАЩ

┼Ъ─Бс╣нy─Бyani (Do., p. 664.).тАФтАШThe sixteen days during the month of Nabhasya, when the sun is in the sign of Virgo, constitute the time for the performance of ┼Ъr─Бddha.тАЩ

┼Ъ─Бс╣нy─Бyani (Do., p. 665).тАФтАШThe sun in Virgo is very sacred; so also is the fifth fortnight (after ─Ас╣г─Бс╕Нh─л).тАЩ

Devala (Par─Б┼Ыaram─Бdhava, p. 665.).тАФтАШSixteen days, formed by the first day of the bright fortnight, which follow the moonless day.тАЩ

J─Бb─Бli (Do., p. 665).тАФтАШDuring the fifth fortnight following the full-moon day of ─Ас╣г─Бс╕Нha,тАФeven though the sun may have not entered the sign of Virgo, one should offer ┼Ъr─Бddha; that fortnight is the most commended for the performance of ┼Ъr─Бddha.тАЩ

Bс╣Ыhat-Manu (Do.).тАФтАШDuring the fifth fortnight after the fullmoon day of the month of ─Ас╣г─Бс╕Нha, the Pitс╣Ыs desire food and water every day; hence ┼Ъr─Бddha should be offered at that time… even though the sun may or may not have entered the sign of Virgo.тАЩ

─Аdityapur─Бс╣Зa (Do.).тАФтАШ┼Ъr─Бddha is commended even when performed during other fortnights during the time that the sun is in the sign of Virgo; if this happens to ho the fifth fortnight (after the full-moon day of ─Ас╣г─Бс╕Нha), it is all the more commendable.тАЩ

Shloka-Gautama (Do.).тАФтАШDuring the time when the sun is in the sign of Virgo, there are sixteen days that are as good as sacrificial sessions.тАЩ

K─Бrс╣гс╣З─Бjini (Do.).тАФтАШWhether in the beginning or the middle or the end, whenever the sun enters the sign of Virgo, the whole of that fortnight is to be honoured as regards the performance of ┼Ъr─Бddha. During the dark fortnight of Nabhasya, ┼Ъr─Бddha should he performed every day, not excepting the Nand─Б or even the fourteenth day.тАЩ

Brahm─Бс╣Зс╕Нapur─Бс╣Зa (Par─Б┼Ыaram─Бdhava, p. 666).тАФтАШDuring the dark fortnight of the month of Nabhasya, one should perform ┼Ъr─Бddha every day, or during two-thirds, or during one-half, or during one-third of the fortnight.тАЩ

Yama (Do., p. 667).тАФтАШDuring the rains, when the sun is in the sign of Virgo,тАФthe man shall offer ┼Ъr─Бddha between the fifth day of one fortnight and the fifth day of another.тАЩ

Sumantu (Do.).тАФтАШSo long as the sun remains in the sign of Virgo and until he enters the sign of Scorpio, it is time for the offering of ┼Ъr─Бddha.тАЩ

Pur─Бс╣Зa (Par─Б┼Ыaram─Бdhava, p. 667).тАФтАШWhen the sun enters the sign of Virgo, Pitс╣Ыs come to their descendants; till the entering of the sun into the sign of Scorpio, the region of Pitс╣Ыs becomes empty; and on the entrance of the sun into Scorpio, they go away disappointed after having cursed their offspring.тАЩ

─Аdipur─Бс╣Зa (Do.).тАФтАШDuring the rainy season the Pitс╣Ыs empty their abodes, and oppressed by hunger, describe their own sins and desire milk-rice mixed with honey; and hence one should satisfy the Pitс╣Ыs with offerings of milk-rice, mixed with honey, butter and sesamum.тАЩ

G─Бrgya (Do., 668).тАФтАШOn the Nand─Б days (1st, 6th and 11th of the month), on Friday and on the thirteenth day, the householder should not perform ┼Ъr─Бddha.тАЩ

Aс╣Еgiras (Do.).тАФтАШOn the thirteenth day of the dark fortnight, if one offers ┼Ъr─Бddha, the death of his eldest son is certain. If one offers ┼Ъr─Бddha during the asterism of Magh─Б, his eldest son dies.тАЩ

Smс╣Ыtyantara (Do., p. 669).тАФтАШIf one offers ┼Ъr─Бddha on the thirteenth, he should offer it not to one Pitс╣Ы; he shall offer the P─Бrvaс╣Зa ┼Ъr─Бddha.тАЩ

┼Ъaс╣Еkha (Par─Б┼Ыaram─Бdhava, p. 669).тАФтАШOn the expiry of the month of Bh─Бdra, or the thirteenth day in conjunction with the asterism of Magh─Б, one should offer ┼Ъr─Бddha with honey and milk-rice; his forefathers reward him with desirable progeny, fame, heaven, health, and wealth.тАЩ

Mah─Бbh─Бrata (Do.).тАФтАШIf a man performs ┼Ъr─Бddha on the thirteenth, no one in his family ever dies young.тАЩ

Mar─лci (Do., p. 670).тАФтАШOn the fourteenth, ┼Ъr─Бddha should be offered only to those who have died through poison, weapons or wild animals, or those who have killed a Br─Бhmaс╣Зa; for others that day has been condemned.тАЩ

Pracetas (Do.).тАФтАШThe fourteenth has been recommended only for those who died through tree-climbing or iron weapons, or lightning or water or poison and such things.тАЩ

Sumanta (Par─Б┼Ыaramadhava, p. 670).тАФтАШEven the Unitary ┼Ъr─Бddha for one who has died through weapons should be performed on the fourteenth day of the Mah─Бlaya.тАЩ

B├╝hler

276 The days of the dark half of the month, beginning with the tenth, but excepting the fourteenth, are recommended for a funeral sacrifice; (it is) not thus (with) the others.

277 рдпреБрдХреНрд╖реБ рдХреБрд░реНрд╡рдиреН ...{Loading}...

рдпреБрдХреНрд╖реБ рдХреБрд░реНрд╡рдиреН рджрд┐рдирд░реНрдХреНрд╖реЗрд╖реБ
рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рдиреН рдХрд╛рдорд╛рдиреН рд╕рдорд╢реНрдиреБрддреЗ ред
рдЕрдпреБрдХреНрд╖реБ рддреБ рдкрд┐рддреДрдиреН рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рдиреН
рдкреНрд░рдЬрд╛рдВ рдкреНрд░рд╛рдкреНрдиреЛрддрд┐ рдкреБрд╖реНрдХрд▓рд╛рдореН рее рей.реиренрен рее [реиремрен рдореЗрдзрд╛рддрд┐рдерд┐рдкрд╛рдареЗ]

рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рд╖реН рдЯреАрдХрд╛рдГ ...{Loading}...
рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рдореВрд▓рд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ

Performing (the ┼Ыr─Бddha) on the even dates and under the even asterisms, one obtains all desires; and honouring the Pitс╣Ыs on the odd ones, he obtains prosperous offspring.тАФ(277)

рдореЗрдзрд╛рддрд┐рдерд┐рдГ

рдпреБрдЮреНрдЬрд┐ рджрд┐рдирд╛рдирд┐ рджреНрд╡рд┐рддреАрдпрд╛рдЪрддреБрд░реНрдереНрдпрд╛рджреАрдирд┐ ред рдЛрдХреНрд╖рдВ рдирдХреНрд╖рддреНрд░рдВ рддрд╛рдирд┐ рднрд░рдгреНрдпрд╛рджреАрдирд┐ рдпреБрдЮреНрдЬрд┐ рднрд╡рдиреНрддрд┐ ред рдкреНрд░рддрд┐рдкрддреНрддреГрддреАрдпрд╛рдкрдЮреНрдЪрдореАрд╕рдкреНрддрдореАрдирд╡рдореНрдпрд╛рд╕реН253 рддрд┐рдердпреЛ рд╜рдпреБрдЬ рдЙрдЪреНрдпрдиреНрддреЗ ред рджреНрд╡рд┐рддреАрдпрд╛рдЪрддреБрд░реНрдереАрд╖рд╖реНрдареНрдпрд╖реНрддрдореАрджрд╢рдореНрдпреЛ рдпреБрдЬрдГ ред рдПрд╡рдореН рдПрдХрд╛рджрд╢реНрдпрдпреБрдХреНрдкреНрд░рднреГрддреМ рджреНрд░рд╖реНрдЯрд╡реНрдпрдореН рдирдХреНрд╖рддреНрд░реЗрд╖реНрд╡реН рдЕрдкрд┐ ред рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рдиреН рдХрд╛рдорд╛рдиреН ред рддреЗ рдЪ рдХрд╛рдорд╛ рдЗрддрд┐рд╣рд╛рд╕рдкреБрд░рд╛рдирдпреЛрд░реН рднреЗрджреЗрдиреЛрдкрддреНрддрд╛рдГ ред рдкреБрд╖реНрдХрд▓рд╛рдВ рдкреНрд░рдЬрд╛рдореН ред рдзрдирд╡рд┐рджреНрдпрд╛рдмрд▓рдкреБрд░реБрд╖реИрдГ рдкреБрд╖реНрдЯрд╛ рдкреБрд╖реНрдХрд▓рд╛ рее рей.реиремрен рее

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рднрд╛рд╖реНрдпрд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ

тАШEven datesтАЩтАФthe second, the fourth, and so forth.

тАШAsterismтАЩтАФlunar mansion; тАШBharaс╣З─л,тАЩ and the rest are called тАШeven asterisms.тАЩ

The first, the third, the fifth, the seventh and the ninth days of the month are called тАШodd;тАЩ and the second, the fourth, the sixth, the eighth and the tenth are called тАШeven.тАЩ Similarly, the eleventh day is тАШodd,тАЩ and so on with the asterisms also.

тАШAll desires,тАЩтАФthe desires being described in detail in Itih─Бsas and Pur─Бс╣Зas.

тАШProsperous offspring,тАЩтАФthat which is replete with persons possessed of wealth, learning and strength, is called тАШprosperous.тАЩтАФ (277)

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рдЯрд┐рдкреНрдкрдиреНрдпрдГ

This verse is quoted in Hem─Бdri (K─Бla, p. 512), which explains тАШyukс╣гuтАЩ and тАШayukс╣гuтАЩ as тАШevenтАЩ and тАШoddтАЩ, res pectively;тАФand in Hem─Бdri (┼Ъr─Бddha, p. 266).

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рддреБрд▓реНрдп-рд╡рд╛рдХреНрдпрд╛рдирд┐

─Аpastamba-Dharmas┼лtra (2.16.8-22).тАФтАШIf one performs the ┼Ъr─Бddha on the first day, he obtains children most of whom are female; if on the second day, he obtains children who become thieves; if on the third day, he obtains children endowed with Br─Бhmic glory; if on the fourth day, he obtains cattle of poor quality; if on the fifth day, he obtains male children, many in number and he does not die childless; if on the sixth day, his son becomes expert in travelling and in gambling; if on the seventh, his agriculture prospers; if on the eighth, he obtains sound health; if on the ninth, he obtains one-hoofed cattle; if on the tenth, his business prospers; if on the eleventh, he obtains articles of iron and lead; if on с╣нhe twelfth, he obtains much cattle; if on the thirteenth, he obtains many sons, many friends, beautiful children; if on the fourteenth, he prospers in weapons; if on the fifteenth, he obtains prosperty.тАЩ

Viс╣гс╣Зu (78.36-49).тАФтАШOn the first he obtains house and beautiful wives; on the second, a girl bestowing benefits; on the third, all desirable things; on the fourth, cattle; on the fifth, beautiful sons; on the sixth, success in gambling; on the seventh, success in agriculture; on the eighth, trade; on the ninth, cattle; on the tenth, horses; on the eleventh, sons endowed with Br─Бhmic glory; on с╣нhe twelfth gold and silver; on the thirteenth, good luck; on the fifteenth, all desirable things.тАЩ

Y─Бj├▒avalkya (1.262-267).тАФтАШDaughters, sons-in-law, cattle, good sons, gambling, agriculture, trade, cleft-hoofed cattle, one-hoofed cattle, sons with Br─Бhmic glory, gold and silver and other metals, gratified relatives, all desires;тАФthese are obtained by the man who offers ┼Ъr─Бddha from the first day onwards, excepting the fourteenth; also heaven, offspring, glory, bravery, lands, strength, son, honour, good luck, prosperity, supremacy, sovereignty, trade, freedom from disease, fame, freedom from sorrow, the supreme state, wealth, Vedas, successful medication, metal-wealth, cows, goats and sheep, horses, longevityтАФall this is obtained by one who offers the ┼Ъr─Бddha in accordance with law.тАЩ

Gautama (15.4).тАФтАШOr, one may perform the ┼Ъr─Бddha whenever he gets suitable substances, place and Br─Бhmaс╣Зas.тАЩ

B├╝hler

277 He who performs it on the even (lunar) days and under the even constellations, gains (the fulfilment of) all his wishes; he who honours the manes on odd (lunar days) and under odd (constellations), obtains distinguished offspring.

278 рдпрдерд╛ рдЪреИрд╡рд╛рд╜рдкрд░рдГ ...{Loading}...

рдпрдерд╛ рдЪреИрд╡рд╛рд╜рдкрд░рдГ рдкрдХреНрд╖рдГ
рдкреВрд░реНрд╡рдкрдХреНрд╖рд╛рджреН рд╡рд┐рд╢рд┐рд╖реНрдпрддреЗ ред
рддрдерд╛ рд╢реНрд░рд╛рджреНрдзрд╕реНрдп рдкреВрд░реНрд╡рд╛рд╣реНрдгрд╛рджреН
рдЕрдкрд░рд╛рд╣реНрдгреЛ рд╡рд┐рд╢рд┐рд╖реНрдпрддреЗ рее рей.реиренрео рее [реиремрео рдореЗрдзрд╛рддрд┐рдерд┐рдкрд╛рдареЗ]

рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рд╖реН рдЯреАрдХрд╛рдГ ...{Loading}...
рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рдореВрд▓рд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ

Just as, for purposes of ┼Ыr─Бddha, the latter half of the month is preferable to the former half, so also, the afternoon is preferable to the forenoon.тАФ(278)

рдореЗрдзрд╛рддрд┐рдерд┐рдГ

рдкреВрд░реНрд╡рдкрдХреНрд╖рдГ рд╢реБрдХреНрд▓рдкрдХреНрд╖рдГ рдЕрдкрд░рдГ рдХреГрд╖реНрдгрдкрдХреНрд╖рдГ ред рдЪреИрддреНрд░рд╕рд┐рддрд╛рджреНрдпрд╛ рдорд╛рд╕рд╛ рдЗрддрд┐ ред рдпрдерд╛ рд╢реНрд░рд╛рджреНрдзрд╕реНрдп рд╢реБрдХреНрд▓рдкрдХреНрд╖рд╛рддреН рдХреГрд╖реНрдгрдкрдХреНрд╖реЛ рд╡рд┐рд╢рд┐рд╖реНрдпрддреЗ рдкреНрд░рдХреГрд╖реНрдЯрдлрд▓рджреЛ рднрд╡рддрд┐, рддрдерд╛ рдкреВрд░реНрд╡рд╛рд╣реНрдгрд╛рджреН рдЕрдкрд░рд╛рд╣реНрдгреЛ рд╡рд┐рд╢реЗрд╖рд╡рдЪрдирд╛рддреН ред рдкреВрд░реНрд╡рд╛рд╣реНрдгреЗ рд╜рдкрд┐ рдХрджрд╛рдЪрд┐рддреН рдХрд░реНрддрд╡реНрдпрдореН рдПрд╡реЗрддрд┐ рдкреНрд░рддреАрдпрддреЗ ред

  • рдирдиреБ рдЪ рдкреНрд░рд╕рд┐рджреНрдзреЗрди рджреГрд╖реНрдЯрд╛рдиреНрддреЗрди рднрд╡рд┐рддрд╡реНрдпрдореН ред рди рдЪрд╛рдкрд░рдкрдХреНрд╖рд╕реНрдп рдкреВрд░реНрд╡рдкрдХреНрд╖рд╛рдЪреН рдЫреНрд░рд╛рджреНрдзрдВ рдкреНрд░рддрд┐ рд╡рд┐рд╢реЗрд╖ рдЙрдХреНрддрдГ ред

  • рдХреЗрдЪрд┐рджреН рдЖрд╣реБрдГ ред “рдХреГрд╖реНрдгрдкрдХреНрд╖реЗ рджрд╢рдореНрдпрд╛рджреМ” (рдореНрдзреН рей.реиремрем) рдЗрддреНрдпреН рдПрддрд╕реНрдорд╛рддреН рдкреНрд░рддреАрдпрддреЗ ред

  • рдПрд╡рдВ рддреБ рдмреНрд░реВрдордГ ред “рд╡рдЪрдирд╛рддреН рддреНрд╡реН рдЕрдкреВрд░реНрд╡рддреНрд╡рд╛рддреН” (рдкреНрдореНрд╕реН рей.рел.реирез) рдЗрддреНрдпреН рдЕрдиреЗрди рдиреНрдпрд╛рдпреЗрдирд╛рдкреНрд░рддрд┐рд╕рд┐рджреНрдзрд╕реНрдп рджреГрд╖реНрдЯрд╛рдиреНрддрддрд╛рд╕реНрддреАрддрд┐ ред рд╡рд┐рдзрд┐рд░реН рдЕрдкрд┐ рджреГрд╖реНрдЯрд╛рдиреНрддрд╡рдЪрдирд╛рджреН рдПрд╡ рд╢рдХреНрдпреЛ рд╜рд╡рдЧрдиреНрддреБрдореН рее рей.реиремрео рее

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рднрд╛рд╖реНрдпрд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ

тАШFortner halt of the monthтАЩ is the brighter fortnight; and тАШlatter halfтАЩ is the darker fortnight;тАФmonths being counted from the brighter fortnight of Caitra onwards.

Just as, for purposes of ┼Ъr─Бddha, the darker fortnight is preferable toтАФis productive of better results than -the brighter fortnight, so is the afternoon preferable to the forenoon. From the declaration of this тАШpreference,тАЩ it follows that in some cases one might perform a ┼Ыr─Бddha during the forenoon also.

тАЬAs a rule, the illustration should be well known; as a matter of fact, however, nowhere has the text declared the superiority of the darker fortnight to the brighter fortnight, for purposes of ┼Ъr─Бddha. [Hence the illustration is not apt].тАЭ

Some people explain that the said superiority is understood from what has been said under 276, regarding the тАШdarker fortnightтАЩ and тАШdays beginning with the tenth.тАЩ Our explanation, however, is as follows:тАФAccording to the principle laid down in M─лm─Бс╣Гs─Бs┼лtra 3. 5. 21, even an unknown fact can serve as an illustration; so that, in the case in question, from the citation of the illustration itself we may even deduce the necessary injunction (regarding the performance of Sharddhas ( ┼Ъr─Бddhas?) during the darker fortnight).тАФ(278)

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рдЯрд┐рдкреНрдкрдиреНрдпрдГ

Medh─Бtithi (P. 297, l. 16)тАФтАШVacan─Бni tvap┼лrvatv─Бt.тАЩтАФThis is M─лm─Бс╣Гs─Б s┼лtra 3.5.21. The question arising as to whether or not there should be an тАШeating of remnantsтАЩ in the case of the Soma juice,тАФthe conclusion is that there should be the eating of it; and this conclusion is based upon a passage referring to a totally different subject; which shows that even an unknown fact can serve as an illustration in support of a definite conclusion.

This verse is quoted in K─Бlaviveka (p. 366), which explains that the precise meaning of the verse is that тАШfrom the three parts into which the day is divided, forenoon, mid-day and afternoon, the afternoon is superior to the other two.тАЩ

This verse is quoted in Apar─Бrka (p. 465), which adds that the term тАШapar─Бhс╣ЗaтАЩ stands here, not for the fourth part of the day divided into five parts, but simply for тАШthe latter half of the day,тАЩ which is its etymological meaning;тАФin Puruс╣г─Бrthacint─Бmaс╣Зi (p. 373);тАФin ┼Ъr─Бddhakriyakaumud─л (p. 314);тАФin Varс╣гakriy─Бkaumud─л (p. 236);тАФin ┼Ъr─Бddhakaumud─л (p. 248); and in K─Бlam─Бdhava (p. 109).

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рддреБрд▓реНрдп-рд╡рд╛рдХреНрдпрд╛рдирд┐

─Аpastamba-Dharmas┼лtra. (2.16.45).тАФтАШThe afternoon of the darker fortnight is more commendable.тАЩ

Y─Бj├▒avalkya (1.226).тАФтАШHaving worshipped the Br─Бhmaс╣Зas in the afternoon, etc.тАЩ

Vy─Бsa (Apar─Бrka, p. 465).тАФтАШThree muhurtas constitute the morning, three muh┼лrtas again form the Saс╣Еgava; three, midday; another three, afternoon.

┼Ъruti (Do.).тАФтАШThe morning is for the gods, the midday for men and the afternoon for Pitс╣Ыs.тАЩ

B├╝hler

278 As the second half of the month is preferable to the first half, even so the afternoon is better for (the performance of) a funeral sacrifice than the forenoon.

279 рдкреНрд░рд╛рдЪреАрдирд╛рд╡реАрддрд┐рдирд╛ рд╕рдореНрдпрдЧреН ...{Loading}...

рдкреНрд░рд╛рдЪреАрдирд╛рд╡реАрддрд┐рдирд╛ рд╕рдореНрдпрдЧреН
рдЕрдкрд╕рд╡реНрдпрдореН рдЕрддрдиреНрджреНрд░рд┐рдгрд╛ ред
рдкрд┐рддреНрд░реНрдпрдореН рдЖ рдирд┐рдзрдирд╛рддреН рдХрд╛рд░реНрдпрдВ
рд╡рд┐рдзрд┐рд╡рджреН рджрд░реНрдн-рдкрд╛рдгрд┐рдирд╛ рее рей.реиренреп рее [реиремреп рдореЗрдзрд╛рддрд┐рдерд┐рдкрд╛рдареЗ]

рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рд╖реН рдЯреАрдХрд╛рдГ ...{Loading}...
рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рдореВрд▓рд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ

Until death, one shall perform, with assiduity, the rite in honour of the Pitс╣Ыs, according to rule, with the sacred thread passing over the right shoulder, making offerings тАЬfrom off the leftтАЭ (to the right) with ku┼Ыa-grass in his hand.тАФ(279)

рдореЗрдзрд╛рддрд┐рдерд┐рдГ

рдпрддреН рдХрд┐рдВрдЪрд┐рддреН рдкрд┐рддреНрд░реНрдпрдВ рддрддреНрд░ рдХрд░реНрдордгреНрдпреН рдЕрдпрдВ рд╡рд┐рдзрд┐рдГ ред рдкрджрд╛рд░реНрдерд╛рдГ рдкреНрд░рд╛рдЧреН рд╡реНрдпрд╛рдЦреНрдпрд╛рддрд╛рдГ ред рдЕрддрдиреНрджреНрд░рд┐рдгрд╛ рдЕрдирд▓рд╕реЗрди рд╢реНрд░рджреНрджрдзрд╛рдиреЗрдиреЗрддрд┐ рдпрд╛рд╡рддреН ред рдЖ рдирд┐рдзрдирд╛рджреН рдЖ рдорд░рдгрд╛рддреН, рдпрд╛рд╡рдЬреНрдЬреАрд╡рд┐рдХреЛ рд╜рдпрдВ рд╡рд┐рдзрд┐рд░реН рдЗрддреНрдпреН рдЕрд░реНрдердГ ред рджрд░реНрднрдкрд╛рдгрд┐рдирд╛ ред рддрджреН рдЙрдХреНрддрдореН “рджрд░реНрднрд╛рдГ рдкрд╡рд┐рддреНрд░рдореН” (рдореНрдзреН рей.реирекрем) рдЗрддрд┐ ред рддрджреН рдЧреНрд░рдерд┐рддрд╢реАрд░реНрд╖рдХрдВ рджрд░реНрднрдордпрдВ рдкрд╡рд┐рддреНрд░рдореН рдЙрдЪреНрдпрддреЗ рее рей.реиремреп рее

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рднрд╛рд╖реНрдпрд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ

This injunction applies to every act that may be done in honour of the Pitс╣Ыs.

The special terms used have all been explained before.

тАШWith assiduityтАЩтАФWithout sloth; i.e., with due faith.

тАШUntil death.тАЩтАФ This shows that the injunction is meant to be observed as long as one lives.

тАШWith Ku┼Ыa-grass in his hand.тАЩтАФIt has been said above (under 256) regarding тАШKu┼Ыa-grass, the Pavitra, &c.тАЩтАФтАШpavitraтАЩ is the name given to a thing made of Ku┼Ыa-grass, with a knot at the top.тАФ(279)

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рдЯрд┐рдкреНрдкрдиреНрдпрдГ

тАШ─Аnidhan─БtтАЩтАФтАШUntil deathтАЩ (Medh─Бtithi and Govindar─Бja);тАФтАШup at to the end of the ceremonyтАЩ (Kull┼лka, N─Бr─Бyaс╣Зa, Nandana and R─Бghav─Бnanda).

This verse is quoted in Par─Б┼Ыaram─Бdhava (─Аc─Бra, p. 725) in support of the view that тАШall the detailed ┼Ъr─Бddha rites beginning with the pouring of water round the dish to the end should be done while one has his thread hanging on his right, shoulderтАЩ;тАФin V─лramitrodaya (─Аhnika, p. 345), which explains тАШatandriс╣З─БтАЩ as тАШwithout laziness,тАЩтАФтАШ─Бnidhan─БtтАЩ as тАШbeginning with death,тАЩ adding that the Maithilas explain this to mean тАШtill the end of the ceremonyтАЩ;тАФin ┼Ъr─Бddho kriy─Бkaumudi (p. 44), which explains тАШapasavyamтАЩ as

тАШv─Бm─Бvartakrameс╣Зa,тАЩ and тАШ─Бnidhan─БtтАЩ as тАШto the end of the ┼Ъr─Бddha.тАЩ

Smс╣Ыtitattva quotes this verse on p. 185, in support of the view that the Ulk─Б-bhramaс╣Зa, тАШBrandishing of the Firebrand,тАЩ which is done on the fifteenth day of K─Бrtika, being an act done in honour of the Pitс╣Ыs, should be done with the sacred thread passing over the right, shoulder;тАФagain on p. 231, in support of the view that the reciting of certain hymns that is laid down as to be done during the ┼Ъr─Бddha, should be done with the sacred thread passing over the right shoulder;тАФagain on p. 236, where it is explained that тАШapasavyaтАЩ means тАШpitс╣Ы-t─лrtha,тАЩ i.e., the part of the palm between the thumb and the index-finger;тАФand again in vol. II, p. 303, in support of the view that all the rites that are performed тАШafter deathтАЩ (─Бnidhan─Бt) should be done with the sacred thread passing over the right shoulder.

It is quoted in Gad─Бdharapaddhati (K─Бla, p. 527), which reads тАШatantriс╣З─БтАЩ and explains it as тАШanolasena,тАЩ and тАШapasavyamтАЩ as тАШon the left side,тАЩ тАШ─Бnidhan─БtтАЩ as тАШtill the end of the performanceтАЩ;тАФin Nс╣Ыsiс╣Гhapras─Бda (┼Ъr─Бddha, p. 24b);тАФand in Hem─Бdri (┼Ъr─Бddha, p. 1107), which has the following notes:тАФтАШPr─Бc─лn─Бv─лtin─Б,тАЩ with the sacred thread hanging over the right shoulder and under the left arm-pit,тАФтАШ─Бnidhan─Бt,тАЩ тАШtill the end,тАЩтАФтАШdarbhap─Бс╣Зin─Б,тАЩ is added with a view to show that everything that is done for the sake of the Pitс╣Ыs should be done ku┼Ыa in hand.

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рддреБрд▓реНрдп-рд╡рд╛рдХреНрдпрд╛рдирд┐

Y─Бj├▒avalkya (1.232).тАФтАШHaving the sacred thread hanging over the right shoulder, he shall make the offering to the Pitс╣Ыs.тАЩ

B├╝hler

279 Let him, untired, duly perform the (rites) in honour of the manes in accordance with the prescribed rule, passing the sacred thread over the right shoulder, proceeding from the left to the right (and) holding Kusa grass in his hands, up to the end (of the ceremony).

280 рд░рд╛рддреНрд░реМ рд╢реНрд░рд╛рджреНрдзрдореН ...{Loading}...

рд░рд╛рддреНрд░реМ рд╢реНрд░рд╛рджреНрдзрдВ рди рдХреБрд░реНрд╡реАрдд
рд░рд╛рдХреНрд╖рд╕реА рдХреАрд░реНрддрд┐рддрд╛ рд╣рд┐ рд╕рд╛ ред
рд╕рдиреНрдзреНрдпрдпреЛрд░реН рдЙрднрдпреЛрд╢реН рдЪреИрд╡
рд╕реВрд░реНрдпреЗ рдЪреИрд╡рд╛рд╜рдЪрд┐рд░реЛрджрд┐рддреЗ рее рей.реиреореж рее [реиренреж рдореЗрдзрд╛рддрд┐рдерд┐рдкрд╛рдареЗ]

рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рд╖реН рдЯреАрдХрд╛рдГ ...{Loading}...
рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рдореВрд▓рд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ

One should not perform ┼Ъr─Бddha at night; for the night has been declared to be тАШfit for demons;тАЩтАФnor at the two twilights, nor when the sun has just risen.тАФ(280)

рдореЗрдзрд╛рддрд┐рдерд┐рдГ рдирдиреБ рдЪрд╛рдкрд░рд╛рд╣реНрдгрд╡рд┐рдзрд╛рдирд╛рддреН[^рекрепрез] рдХреБрддреЛ рд░рд╛рддреНрд░реНрдпрд╛рджрд┐рд╖реБ рдкреНрд░рд╛рдкреНрддрд┐рдГ ред рдЕрде рдорддрд╡рд┐рд╢реЗрд╖рд╡рдЪрдиреЗрди,[^рекрепреи] рдЕрдиреНрдпрддреНрд░рд╛рдкреНрдпреН рдЕрд╕реНрддреАрддрд┐ рдЬреНрдЮрд╛рдкрд┐рддрдореН ред рд╕рддреНрдпрдореН ред "рдкреВрд░реНрд╡рд╛рд╣реНрдгрд╛рджреН рдЕрдкрд░рд╛рд╣реНрдгреЛ рд╡рд┐рд╢рд┐рд╖реНрдпрддреЗ" (рдореНрдзреН рей.резремрео) рдЗрддрд┐ рдпрджрдкреЗрдХреНрд╖рдВ рд╡рд┐рд╢реЗрд╖рд╡рдЪрдирдВ рддрддреНрд░реИрд╡рд╛рд╕реНрддреАрддрд┐ рд╕рд╛рдорд╛рдиреНрдпрдЬреНрдЮрд╛рдирдВ рдкреНрд░рд╡рд░реНрддрддреЗ ред

  • рддреЗрди рдкреВрд░реНрд╡рд╛рд╣реНрдг рдПрд╡ рдХрджрд╛рдЪрд┐рддреН рддрд╕реНрдпрд╛рдиреНрдп рдЙрддреНрддрд░рдХрд╛рд▓ рдЗрддрд┐ рдХреЗрдЪрд┐рджреН рдЖрд╣реБрдГ ред “рдЧреНрд░рд╣рдгрдВ рдЪрдиреНрджреНрд░рд╕реВрд░реНрдпрдпреЛрдГ” (рдпреНрдзреН рез.реирезрео) рдЗрддрд┐ рдЪрдиреНрджреНрд░рдЧреНрд░рд╣рд╛рджрд┐рд╖реБ рд░рд╛рддреНрд░реНрдпрд╛рджрд╛рд╡реН рдЕрдкрд┐ рдкреНрд░рд╛рдкреНрддрдГ, рддрдиреНрдирд┐рд╖реЗрдзрд╛рд░реНрдердореН ред рдЕрддрд╢реН рдЪ рд╕рдВрдзреНрдпрд╛рдпрд╛рдВ рдЪрдиреНрджреНрд░рд╕реВрд░реНрдпрдпреЛрд░реН рдЙрдкрд░рд╛рдЧреЗрдг рд░рд╛рддреНрд░реМ рдЪрдиреНрджреНрд░рдЧреНрд░рд╣рдгреЗ рдкреНрд░рддрд┐рд╖реЗрдзрд╛рддреН, рд╡рд┐рдзрд╛рдирд╛рджреН рд╡рд┐рдХрд▓реНрдкрдГ ред

  • рдЕрдиреНрдпреЗ рддреНрд╡реН рдЖрд╣реБрдГ- рдордзреНрдпрд╛рд╣реНрдирдХрд╛рд▓рдГ рдкреВрд░реНрд╡рд╛рд╣реНрдгрд╛рдкрд░рд╛рд╣реНрдгрд╛рднреНрдпрд╛рдореН рдЕрдиреНрдпрд╕реН рддрддреНрд░рд╛рдкреНрдпреН рдПрддреЗрди рдкреНрд░рддрд┐рд╖реЗрдзреЗрди рдХрд░реНрддрд╡реНрдпрдореН рдЗрддрд┐ рдЬреНрдЮрд╛рдкреНрдпреЗрддреН ред

  • рд╕реВрд░реНрдпреЗ рдЪреИрд╡ рдкреВрд░реНрд╡рд╛рд╣реНрдгрдХрд╛рд▓рддреНрд╡рд╛рддреН рдкреНрд░рдердореЛрджрд┐рддреЗ рд╕реВрд░реНрдпреЗ рдкреНрд░рддрд┐рд╖реЗрдзрдГ ред рд░рд╛рдХреНрд╖рд╕реАрддреНрдпреН рдЕрд░реНрдерд╡рд╛рджрдГ рее рей.реиренреж рее

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рднрд╛рд╖реНрдпрд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ

ObjectionтАФтАЬInasmuch as it has been laid down that ┼Ъr─Бddhas shall be performed in the afternoon, where was there any possibility of performance at night (that it should have been considered necessary to prohibit it)? It might be argued that the specification of the time itself implies the possibility of performance at other times also. This may be true; but the specification contained in the words, тАШthe afternoon is preferable to the forenoon,тАЩ (278) clearly indicates that the performance is possible only at that time, in comparison with which the prescribed time has been declared to be тАШpreferable;тАЩ so that the only other time at which the ┼Ъr─Бddha might be performed is the forenoon (and never the night).тАЭ

In answer to this, some people offer the following explanation:тАФThe present text serves to prohibit the performance at night, which might be possible under the direction that ┼Ъr─Бddhas shall be performed during lunar and solar eclipses. So that there being prohibition regarding the twilights and the night, and sanction regarding lunar and solar eclipses, there is option between the. two twilights and the two eclipses, as also between the lunar eclipse and night.

Others, however, have explained that тАШmiddayтАЩ is a time different from both тАШafternoonтАЩ and тАШforenoon;тАЩ and the present prohibition implies that there should be no performance at that time also.

тАШWhen the sun has just risen,тАЩтАФthe time being the forenoon, the prohibition applies to the first rising of the sun.

тАШFit for demonsтАЩтАФthis is a purely reiterative exaggeration.тАФ(280).

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рдЯрд┐рдкреНрдкрдиреНрдпрдГ

This verse is quoted in K─Бlaviveka (p. 527) as forbidding the performance of ┼Ъr─Бddhas at night;тАФin Smс╣Ыtitattva, on p. 172, and again on p. 266 as precluding certain times for the performance of ┼Ъr─Бddhas;тАФin Puruс╣г─Бrthacint─Бmaс╣Зi (p. 373);тАФin Hem─Бdri (K─Бla, p. 586), which says that the night is excluded because R─Бkс╣гasas stalk

about at night, so that if ┼Ъr─Бddha were offered at night, the R─Бkс╣гasas would take it away; it should also not be done either in the morning or, in the evening twilight;тАФin Kс╣Ыtyas─Бrasamuccaya (p. 37), which explains тАШSurye achiroditeтАЩ as within three muh┼лrtas of sun-rise;тАФin K─Бlam─Бdhava (p. 157);тАФin Hem─Бdri (┼Ъr─Бddha, p. 329);тАФin ┼Ъr─Бddhakriy─Бkaumud─л (p. 305), which explains тАШsurye &c.тАЩ as тАШduring the first muh┼лrta of the sunrise, which is forbidden in reference to ┼Ъr─Бddha only;тАФin Suddhikaumudi (p. 194);тАФin Hem─Бdri (┼Ъr─Бddha, p. 329);тАФand in Nс╣Ыsiс╣Гhapras─Бda (┼Ъr─Бddha, p. 20b).

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рддреБрд▓реНрдп-рд╡рд╛рдХреНрдпрд╛рдирд┐

─Аpastamba-Dharmas┼лtra (2. 17. 23).тАФтАШOne shall not per form the ┼Ъr─Бddha at night.тАЩ

Viс╣гс╣Зu (77. 8).тАФтАШWise men shall not perform ┼Ъr─Бddha either in the evening or at night; even during these times it should be done if R─Бhu (Eclipse) becomes visible.тАЩ

Laghu-┼Ъ─Бt─Бtapa (94).тАФтАШOne shall not perform ┼Ъr─Бddha during the night, except during an eclipse; during the two twilights however, it should never be performed.тАЩ

B├╝hler

280 Let him not perform a funeral sacrifice at night, because the (night) is declared to belong to the Rakshasas, nor in the twilight, nor when the sun has just risen.

281 рдЕрдиреЗрди рд╡рд┐рдзрд┐рдирд╛ ...{Loading}...

рдЕрдиреЗрди рд╡рд┐рдзрд┐рдирд╛ рд╢реНрд░рд╛рджреНрдзрдВ
рддреНрд░рд┐рд░реН рдЕрдмреНрджрд╕реНрдпреЗрд╣ рдирд┐рд░реНрд╡рдкреЗрддреН ред
рд╣реЗрдордиреНрдд-рдЧреНрд░реАрд╖реНрдо-рд╡рд░реНрд╖рд╛рд╕реБ
рдкрд╛рдЮреНрдЪрдпрдЬреНрдЮрд┐рдХрдореН рдЕрдиреНрд╡рд╣рдореН рее рей.реиреорез рее [реиренрез рдореЗрдзрд╛рддрд┐рдерд┐рдкрд╛рдареЗ]

рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рд╖реН рдЯреАрдХрд╛рдГ ...{Loading}...
рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рдореВрд▓рд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ

In accordance with this rule, one should offer ┼Ъr─Бddha thrice in the yearтАФduring winter, summer and the rain; and that which forms part of the тАЬfive sacrificesтАЭ should be done every day.тАФ(281)

рдореЗрдзрд╛рддрд┐рдерд┐рдГ

рдкреВрд░реНрд╡реЛрдХреНрддреЗрди рд╡рд┐рдзрд┐рдирд╛ рдЗрддрд┐рдХрд░реНрддрд╡реНрдпрддрд╛рдХрд▓рд╛рдкреЗрди рдкреВрд░реНрд╡реЗрджреБрд░реН рдирд┐рдордиреНрддреНрд░рдгрд╛рджрд┐рднрд┐рдГ рд╕рдВрд╡рддреНрд╕рд░рд╕реНрдп рддреНрд░рд┐рдГ рд╢реНрд░рд╛рджреНрдзрдВ рдХреБрд░реНрд╡реАрдд ред рдХреЗрд╖реБ рдорд╛рд╕реЗрд╖реНрд╡реН рдЗрддреНрдпреН рдЕрдд рдЖрд╣- рд╣реЗрдордиреНрддрдЧреНрд░реАрд╖реНрдорд╡рд░реНрд╖рд╛рд╕реБ ред “рдорд╛рд╕рд╛рдиреБрдорд╛рд╕рд┐рдХрдореН” (рдореНрдзреН рей.резрезреи) рдЗрддреНрдпреН рдЕрд╕реНрдп рддреНрд░рд┐рдГ рд╕рдВрд╡рддреНрд╕рд░рд╡рд┐рдзрд┐рд░реН рд╡реИрдХрд▓реНрдкрд┐рдХрдГ ред рдкрд╛рдЮреНрдЪрдпрдЬреНрдЮрд┐рдХрдГ рдкрдЮреНрдЪрдорд╣рд╛рдпрдЬреНрдЮрдордзреНрдпреЗ рдпрдГ рдкрдард┐рддрдГ рд╕реЛ рд╜рдиреНрд╡рд╣рдВ рдХрд░реНрддрд╡реНрдпрдГ ред рдЕрд╕реНрдп рдЪ рдкреНрд░рд╛рдЪреАрдирд╛рд╡реАрддреНрдпрдкрд╕рд╡реНрдпреЛрджрдЩреНрдореБрдЦрдмреНрд░рд╛рд╣реНрдордгрднреЛрдЬрдирдореН рдЗрддреНрдпреН рдПрддрд╛рд╡рддреНрдпреН рдПрд╡реЗрддрд┐рдХрд░реНрддрд╡реНрдпрддрд╛ ред рдПрд╡рдорд░реНрдердореН рдПрд╡ рдкреБрдирд░реН рдЙрдкрдиреНрдпрд╛рд╕рдГ ред рдПрд╡рдВ рддреНрд░рд┐рдГрд╕рдВрд╡рддреНрд╕рд░рд╡рд┐рдзрд┐рд░реН рдЕрдирд╛рд╣рд┐рддрд╛рдЧреНрдиреЗрд░реН рдЗрддреНрдпреН рдПрд╡рдВ рдкреВрд░реНрд╡реЗ рд╡реНрдпрд╛рдЪрдХреНрд╖рддреЗ, рдкреНрд░рдорд╛рдгрдВ рддреБ рдд рдПрд╡ рд╡рд┐рджрдиреНрддрд┐ рее рей.реиренрез рее

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рднрд╛рд╖реНрдпрд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ

In accordance with the rules laid down hereтАФi.e., following the procedure, beginning with inviting the Br─Бhmaс╣Зas on the previous day, and ending with performing the ┼Ъr─Бddha thrice in the yearтАФone should offer the ┼Ъr─БddhaтАФin what months ?тАФтАШduring winter, summer and the rains.тАЩ

What is said here regarding the ┼Ъr─Бddha to be offered тАШthrice in the yearтАЩ is to be regarded as optional with what has been said above (122) regarding its being offered тАШmonth after month.тАЩ

тАШThat which forms part of the Five SacrificesтАЩтАФthat which has been prescribed among the тАШFive SacrificesтАЩтАФshould be performed every day.

In connection with this last, the only procedure to be adopted consists inтАФ(a) wearing the sacred thread over the right shoulder, (b) making offerings from left to right, and (c) feeding the Br─Бhmaс╣Зas with face towards the north. That is why it has been re-mentioned here.

It is in view of this text that older people have explained that the rule regarding the offering of ┼Ъr─Бddha thrice in the year is meant for one who has not set up the fire. But what authority they have for this, they alone know.тАФ(281)

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рдЯрд┐рдкреНрдкрдиреНрдпрдГ

This verse is quoted in Apar─Бrka (p. 420);тАФand in Gad─Бdharapaddhati (K─Бla, p. 467).

B├╝hler

281 Let him offer here below a funeral sacrifice, according to the rule given above, (at least) thrice a year, in winter, in summer, and in the rainy season, but that which is included among the five great sacrifices, every day.

рдЕрдЧреНрдирд┐рдирд┐рдпрдордГ

282 рди рдкреИрддреГрдпрдЬреНрдЮрд┐рдпреЛ ...{Loading}...

рди рдкреИрддреГрдпрдЬреНрдЮрд┐рдпреЛ рд╣реЛрдореЛ
рд▓реМрдХрд┐рдХреЗ рд╜рдЧреНрдиреМ рд╡рд┐рдзреАрдпрддреЗ ред
рди рджрд░реНрд╢реЗрди рд╡рд┐рдирд╛ рд╢реНрд░рд╛рджреНрдзрдореН
рдЖрд╣рд┐рддрд╛рдЧреНрдиреЗрд░реН рджреНрд╡рд┐рдЬрдиреНрдордирдГ рее рей.реиреореи рее [реиренреи рдореЗрдзрд╛рддрд┐рдерд┐рдкрд╛рдареЗ]

рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рд╖реН рдЯреАрдХрд╛рдГ ...{Loading}...
рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рдореВрд▓рд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ

The oblation into fire made in connection with the rite in honour of the Pitс╣Ыs has not been prescribed as to be offered into the common fire; and for the Br─Бhmaс╣Зa who has set up the fire, there is no ┼Ъr─Бddha apart from the Moonless day.тАФ(282)

рдореЗрдзрд╛рддрд┐рдерд┐рдГ

рдкрд┐рддреГрдпрдЬреНрдЮрд╛рдЩреНрдЧрднреВрддреЛ рд╣реЛрдордГ рдкреИрддреГрдпрдЬреНрдЮрд┐рдХрдГ рд╕ рд▓реМрдХрд┐рдХреЗ рд╕реНрдорд╛рд░реНрддреЗ рд╜рдЧреНрдиреМ рди рд╡рд┐рдзреАрдпрддреЗ ред рд╢рд╛рд╕реНрддреНрд░реЗрдг рдХрд░реНрддрд╡реНрдпрддрдпрд╛ рди рдЪреЛрджреНрдпрддреЗ ред рддрд╕реНрдорд╛рддреН рддреНрд░рд┐рдГ рд╕рдВрд╡рддреНрд╕рд░рд╕реНрдпрд╛рдирд╛рд╣рд┐рддрд╛рдЧреНрдирд┐рдирд╛ рдХрд░реНрддрд╡реНрдпрдореН ред рдпрджреНрдпреН рдЕрдкрд┐ рддреНрд░рд┐рдГрдХреГрддрдореН рдЕрдкрд┐ рднрд╡рддреНрдпреН рдПрд╡ рдХреГрддрдВ рд▓реМрдХрд┐рдХреЗ рд╜рдЧреНрдиреМ, рддрдерд╛рдкрд┐ рд╕рдВрд╡рддреНрд╕рд░рд╛рдкреЗрдХреНрд╖рдпрд╛ рдЕрдХреГрддрдореН рдПрд╡ рддрджреН рднрд╡рддрд┐ ред рдкреНрд░рд╕реНрдерднреЛрдЬрдиреЛ рд╣рд┐ рдиреНрдпреВрдиреЗ рднреБрдХреНрддреЗ рд╜рднреБрдХреНрдд рдЗрддрд┐254 ред рдЕрд░реНрдерд╡рд╛рджрддрдпрд╛ рдкреВрд░реНрд╡рд╢реЗрд╖рдореН рдЗрджрдВ рдкреВрд░реНрд╡реЗ рд╡реНрдпрд╛рдЪрдХреНрд╖рддреЗ ред

  • рдЗрджрдВ рддреБ рдпреБрдХреНрддрдореН255 ред рдпрджрд┐ рд▓реМрдХрд┐рдХреЛ256 рд╜рдЧреНрдирд┐рд░реН рд╡рд┐рд╡рд╛рд╣рд╛рджрд╛рд╡реН рдЕрдкрд░рд┐рдЧреГрд╣реАрддрд╕реН рддрд╕реНрдорд┐рдЮреН рдЫреНрд░рд╛рджреНрдзрд╛рдЩреНрдЧрднреВрддреЛ рд╣реЛрдореЛ рди рдХрд░реНрддрд╡реНрдп рдЗрддреНрдпреН рдЙрдЪреНрдпрддреЗ ред рд╣реЛрдордкреНрд░рддрд┐рд╖реЗрдзреЗрди рдЪ рддрджреНрд╡реНрдпрддрд┐рд░рд┐рдХреНрддрдореН рдЕрдиреНрдпрддреН рдХрд░реНрдо рдХрд░реНрддрд╡реНрдпрдореН рдЗрддреНрдпреН рдЙрдХреНрддрдВ рднрд╡рддрд┐ ред рдЗрддрд░рдерд╛ рдкрд░рд┐рдЧреГрд╣реАрддрд╛рдЧреНрдиреЗрд░реН рдЕрдкрд┐257 рдкрд╛рд░реНрд╡рдгрд╢реНрд░рд╛рджреНрдзрд╛рдЩреНрдЧрддреНрд╡реЗрди рд╡рд┐рдзрд╛рдирд╛рджреН рдЕрдирдЧреНрдирд┐рдХрд╕реНрдп рд╢реНрд░рд╛рджреНрдзрд╛рдирдзрд┐рдХрд╛рд░ рдПрд╡ рд╕реНрдпрд╛рддреН ред рдпрдерд╛рдиреНрдзрд╕реНрдпрд╛рдЬреНрдпрд╛рд╡реЗрдХреНрд╖рдгрд╛рд╢рдХреНрддреНрдпрд╛ рди рджрд░реНрд╢рдкреМрд░реНрдгрдорд╛рд╕рдпреЛрд░реН рдЕрдзрд┐рдХрд╛рд░рдГ258 ред рдЕрд╕реНрдорд┐рдВрд╕реН рддреБ рд╕рддрд┐ рд╕рд╛рдЧреНрдирд┐рдХрд╕реНрдп рд╣реЛрдорд╡рддреН рд╢реНрд░рд╛рджреНрдзрдореН рдЕрдирдЧреНрдирд┐рдХрд╕реНрдп рддрджреНрд╡рд░реНрдЬрд┐рддрдореН рдЕрдкрд┐ рдЬреНрдЮрд╛рдкрд┐рддрдВ рднрд╡рддрд┐ ред рддрдерд╛ рдЪ “рдЕрдЧреНрдиреНрдпрднрд╛рд╡реЗ” (рдореНрдзреН рей.реирежреи) рдЗрддреНрдпреН рдЕрд╕реНрдпрд╛рдпрдореН рдПрд╡ рд╡рд┐рд╖рдпрдГ ред
  • рдпреЗ рд╜рдкрд┐ рд╡реНрдпрд╛рдЪрдХреНрд╖рддреЗ рдкрд┐рдгреНрдбрдкрд┐рддреГрдпрдЬреНрдЮреЛ рд╜рднрд┐рдкреНрд░реЗрддрдГ рддрддреНрд░ рдпреЛ рд╣реЛрдордГ рд╕ рд▓реМрдХрд┐рдХреЗ рд╕реНрдорд╛рд░реНрддреЗ рд╜рдЧреНрдиреМ рдирд╛рд╕реНрддрд┐, рддреЗ рд╜рдкрд┐ рди рдпреБрдХреНрддрдореН рдЖрд╣реБрдГ ред рдЕрд╕реНрддреНрд╡реН рдПрд╡рдореН259 рдЕрдирд╛рд╣рд┐рддрд╛рдЧреНрдирд┐рд░реН рдирд┐рддреНрдпрддреНрд╡реЗ260 рд╢реНрд░рдкрдпрд┐рддреНрд╡рд╛ рдЬреБрд╣реБрдпрд╛рджреН рдЗрддреНрдпрд╛рджрд┐ ред рди рджрд░реНрд╢реЗрдг рд╡рд┐рдирд╛ рд╢реНрд░рд╛рджреНрдзрдВ рдЧреНрд░рд╣реЛрдкрд░рд╛рдЧрд╛рджрд╛рд╡реН рдЖрд╣рд┐рддрд╛рдЧреНрдирд┐рдГ261 рдкреНрд░рддрд┐рд╖реЗрдз рдЗрддреНрдпреН рдЖрд╣реБрдГ ред рдПрддрддреН рддреБ рд╕рдорд╛рдЪрд╛рд░рд╡рд┐рд░реБрджреНрдзрдореН ред
  • рдЕрдиреНрдпреЗ рддреБ рдкрдардиреНрддрд┐- рди рд╡рд┐рдирд╛ рджрд░реНрд╢ рдЗрддреНрдпреН рдЕрд╕реНрдпрд╛рд╣рд┐рддрд╛рдЧреНрдирд┐рдирд╛262 рдорд╛рд╕рд╛рдиреБрдорд╛рд╕рд┐рдХрдВ рдХрд░реНрддрд╡реНрдпрдореН, рдирд╛рд╕реНрдп рддреНрд░рд┐рдГрд╕рдВрд╡рддреНрд╕рд░рд╡рд┐рдзрд┐рдГ ред рдиреИрд╡рд╛рдпрдВ рдкрд╛рдареЛ рд╜рд╕реНрддреАрддреНрдпреН рдЕрдиреНрдпреЗ ред
  • рдХрд╕реН рддрд░реНрд╣реНрдпреН рдЕрд╕реНрдпрд╛рд░реНрдердГ ред рджрд╛рд░реНрд╢рд╛рддреН рд╢реНрд░рд╛рджреНрдзрд╛рджреН рдЕрдиреНрдпрджреН рдЖрд╣рд┐рддрд╛рдЧреНрдиреЗрд░реН рдордШрд╛рд╢реНрд░рд╛рджреНрдзрд╛рджрд┐ рди рдирд┐рдпрдореЗрди рднрд╡рддреАрддрд┐ рджрд╛рд░реНрд╢рдореН рдПрд╡ рддрд╕реНрдп рдирд┐рдпрддрдореН ред рдЕрдирд╛рд╣рд┐рддрд╛рдЧреНрдиреЗрд╕реН рддреБ рд╣реЗрдордиреНрддрд╛рджрд┐рд╡рд┐рд╣рд┐рддрд╛рдиреНрдпреН рдЕрдкрд┐ рдирд┐рдпрддрд╛рдиреАрддрд┐ рее рей.реиренреи рее
рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рднрд╛рд╖реНрдпрд╛рдиреБрд╡рд╛рджрдГ

The тАШHoma,тАЩ тАШoblation into fire,тАЩ offered in connection with the Rite in honour of the Pitс╣Ыs is called тАШPaitс╣Ыyaj├▒ikahoma;тАЩтАФthis тАШhas not been prescribed as to be offered into the commonтАЩтАФi.e., the Sm─БrtaтАФтАШfire.тАЩ That is, the Scriptures do not enjoin it as to be done in that manner. Hence it follows that the offering of ┼Ъr─Бddha тАШthree times during the yearтАЩ is to be made by one who has not set up the Fire. Though this offering three times would be тАШoffering into the common Fire,тАЩ yet it would be as good as тАШnot done,тАЩ in comparison with what is done throughout the year. For instance, when a man who can eat a seer has eaten less, people are found to say, тАШhe has not eaten.тАЩ

Older commentators have explained this as a reiterative supplement to what has gone in the preceding verse.

The right view to take, however, appears to be that what is said in the text is that the oblation into Fire, in connection with ┼Ъr─Бddhas, should not be offered into the тАШcommon Fire,тАЩтАФi.e., such fire as has not been set up at marriage or other prescribed times. And this prohibition of the тАШoblation into FireтАЩ implies that details other than that may be done in the common fire. If such were not the meaning, then, in view of the fact that the тАШoblation into fire,тАЩ offered by the person who has set up the fire, has been prescribed as part of the P─Бrvaс╣Зa-┼Ъr─Бddha, the person who has not set up the Fire would not be entitled to the performance of ┼Ъr─Бddhas at all; just as, in view of the fact that the blind person cannot do the тАШlooking into the butter,тАЩ he is not entitled to the performance of the Dar┼Ыa P┼лrс╣Зam─Бsa sacrifi-ces. If it be, as we have explained it, then it comes to this that the ┼Ъr─Бddha performed by the man who has set up the fire would be accompanied by oblations into fire, while that performed by one. who has not set up the fire would be without such oblations. And in this, case, what is said here falls within what has been said in verse 212 above.

Some people have offered the following explanation:тАФтАЬWhat is meant here is the Piс╣Зс╕Нapitс╣Ыyaj├▒a; and the oblation into fire that is offered at this is never offered into the Common Fire.тАЭ

Others have said that this is not right, for even so the person who has not set up the Fire might cook the oblation day by day and then offer it.

Others, again, assert that, in view of the phrase, тАШapart from the Moonless Day,тАЩ it follows that by the person who has set up the Fire the ┼Ъr─Бddha should be offered every month; and that the rule regarding тАШthree times in the yearтАЩ does not apply to him.

Others, again, have declared that such is not the reading.

What then is the meaning?

The meaning is that, apart from the ┼Ъr─Бddha performed on the Moonless Day, no other ┼Ъr─БddhaтАФsuch as the тАШMagh─Б-┼Ъr─Бddha,тАЩ and the likeтАФis binding upon him; the former alone being necessary for him. For the person who has not set up the Fire, however, the ┼Ъr─Бddhas prescribed in connection with the winter, etc., also are obligatory.тАФ(282)

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рдЯрд┐рдкреНрдкрдиреНрдпрдГ

This verse is quoted in Smс╣Ыtitattva on p. 174, as laying down that the ┼Ъr─Бddha during the тАШdark fortnightтАЩ should be preformed on the Moonless Day;тАФon p. 35, II, as precluding the offering of Homa-libations in the ordinary fire;тАФand again on II, p. 136, to the same effect.

It is quoted in Vidh─Бnap─Бrij─Бta (II, p. 615), which remarks that it appears as if it were forbidding the performance of ┼Ъr─Бddha by a man тАШwith the FireтАЩ on any but the Moonless Day; and proceeds to note that some people have taken this to mean that if a ┼Ъr─Бddha happens to fall on any other day, the man тАШwith the FireтАЩ should do the тАШsaс╣ЕkalpaтАЩ on that day, but postpone the actual performance till the Moonless Day;тАФbut trustworthy people have held that what is meant is that for the man тАШwith the Fire,тАЩ even if there should arise the necessity of performing a ┼Ъr─Бddha on another day, he should always wait till the Moonless Day.

This verse is quoted in Nirс╣Зayasindhu (p. 111) which remarks that the first half assigns the reason for what is asserted in the second half. It quotes three opinionsтАФ(1) Some people accept this verse in its literal sense; (2) тАШour teachersтАЩ hold that it is meant to forbid for the man тАШwith the fireтАЩ the performance of that ┼Ъr─Бddha only which is done in the form of the тАШPiс╣Зс╕Нapitс╣Ыyaj├▒aтАЩ;тАФ(3) тАШour own opinionтАЩ is that it serves to lay down that if any ┼Ъr─Бddha happens to fall on other days, the Man тАШwith the fireтАЩ should do it on the Moonless DayтАЩ;тАФin Puruс╣г─Бrthacint─Бmaс╣Зi (p. 369), which reproduces the note from Hem─Бdri;тАФin Hem─Бdri (┼Ъr─Бddha, p. 1679) which explains the meaning asтАФтАШThe Agnihotri should not perform any ┼Ъr─Бddha in which the ritualistic details of the Dar┼Ыa-┼Ъr─Бddha are not adoptedтАЩ; that is, he should perform the ┼Ъr─Бddha only in the manner of the Dar┼Ыa-┼Ъr─Бddha; it does not mean that тАШhe should not perform any ┼Ъr─Бddha except the Dar┼ЫaтАЩ;тАФand in ┼Ъr─Бddhakriy─Бkaumud─л (p. 7), which rejects the view set forth by Hem─Бdri, attributing it to Hal─Бyudha.

рдЧрдЩреНрдЧрд╛рдирде-рддреБрд▓реНрдп-рд╡рд╛рдХреНрдпрд╛рдирд┐

Viс╣гс╣Зudharmottara (Caturvargacint─Бmaс╣Зi-┼Ъr─Бddha, p. 2330).тАФтАШOne who has taken to the fire shall make the offerings into the Dakс╣гiс╣З─Бgni; one who is without the fire shall do it either in the Upasada fire, or, in the absence of fire, into the hands of a Br─Бhmaс╣Зa, or in water.тАЩ

V─Бyupur─Бс╣Зa (Do.).тАФтАШHaving kindled either the Dakс╣гin─Бgni, for purposes of Homa, or having kindled the ordinary fire simply for the purpose of having a fire, he shall offer the oblations for the accomplishment of the rite.тАЩ

Y─Бj├▒avalkya (1.97).тАФтАШEvery day the householder shall perform the Sm─Бrta rites in the marriage-fire, or in the fire kindled at the time of inheritance; and the ┼Ъrauta rites in the sacrificial fire.тАЩ

Do. (1(?).236).тАФтАШWhen going to pour the oblation into the fire, he shall take up the food overflowing with butter, and being permitted to go on with the offering, shall pour the oblation into the fire, in the manner of the Pitс╣Ыyaj├▒a.тАЩ

B├╝hler

282 The burnt-oblation, offered at a sacrifice to the manes, must not be made in a common fire; a Brahmana who keeps a sacred fire (shall) not (perform) a funeral sacrifice except on the new-moon day.

  54. M G: t─Бvanm─Бtreс╣З─Бpi dadh─Бti ↩︎

  63. M G 1st ed.: ┼Ыapathena vihitaс╣Г sukс╣Ыtaiс╕е s─Бdhit─Бn svair iti, for: sukс╣Ыtaс╣Г sukс╣Ыtaiс╕е s─Бdhitaс╣Г dharmam ↩︎

  64. G 2nd ed.: saс╣Гb─Бdhakatvaс╣Г ↩︎
